messages.content: What is the purpose of the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI is used to mirror a latent along the Y (vertical/left to right) or X (horizontal/top to bottom) axis, and is best used as part of an img2img workflow.
Where can I find an example nodes JSON for the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?

An example nodes JSON for the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI can be found at https://github.com/spro/comfyui-mirror/blob/main/examples/latent-mirror-example.json, which uses Efficiency Nodes (https://github.com/LucianoCirino/efficiency-nodes-comfyui).
How do I install the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?

To install the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI, clone the repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes` by running the following commands in your terminal: `cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes`, `git clone https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror`, and then restart and refresh ComfyUI.
What are the two types of mirroring supported by the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI supports mirroring along the Y (vertical/left to right) axis and the X (horizontal/top to bottom) axis.
Is the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI best used for img2img workflows or for other types of workflows?
The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI is best used as part of an img2img workflow.
What should I do after cloning the Latent Mirror node repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes`?
After cloning the Latent Mirror node repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes`, you should restart and refresh ComfyUI to complete the installation.
Can I see example images demonstrating the results of using the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?

Yes, you can see example images demonstrating the results of using the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI at https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror/blob/main/examples/nodes.png and https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror/blob/main/examples/example.png.
